DOC.brief_summary: This study aim support hypothesis brain process underlying reward processing impulse control contribute obesity adherence new exercise regimen .
DOC.detailed_description: This nonrandomized trial group define BMI adherence status exercise intervention .
DOC.criteria: BMI > 25 < 40±1 Must live Greater Kansas City area least 1 year Willing exercise Provide write approval license physician healthy enough participate program moderate physical activity maximum O2 test All participant must sedentary except casual recreation softball , bowling , etc . Colorblindness Lefthandedness Any diagnose neurological disorder condition preclude MRI scanning ( e.g. , metal body ) Participation research project involve weight loss physical activity previous 6 month Subjects smoke Subjects use medication affect metabolism ( i.e . thyroid , beta blocker ) , use medication affect appetite ( i.e . Meridia ) exercise ( i.e . walk ) Participants exclude study personnel follow interview exhibit eat disorder , binge eating , depression drug addiction Metabolic disease would affect energy balance ( e.g . diabetes mellitus hypothyroidism ) Pregnant previous 6 month , lactate , plan pregnancy within 12 month Individuals weight stable ( ± 4.5kg ) within previous year . Serious medical risk type 1diabetes , cancer , recent cardiac event ( i.e . heart attack , angioplasty , etc . ) High blood pressure Current use smoking/tobacco product initiation use smoking/tobacco product study alcohol abuse history dependence Subject IQ le 80 Reported radiation exposure CT , PET , fluoroscopic nuclear medicine study within previous year , radiation exposure discretion PI
